content: le square designed by lisa di fruscia for sonder yarn co sonder yarn co | sonderyarnco com | @sonderyarnco | #sonderyarnco le square | page 2 yarn sonder yarn co luna 100% bluefaced leicester 800 m 875 y / 100 g mc 3 skeins shown in leonard or approximately 2182 m 2386 y of lace weight yarn cc 1 skein shown in cinema or approximately 290 m 317 y of lace weight yarn needles size 3 5 mm us 4 or size needed to obtain gauge - dpns as well as circular needles that increase in cord length as your square grows notions 4 stitch markers one a different colour for bor 1 locking stitch marker tapestry needle to weave in ends blocking wires and pins optional gauge 26 sts and 45 row per 10 cm / 4 in stockinette stitch after blocking to save time and ensure accurate measurements take time to check gauge dimensions 130 cm x 130 cm 51 x 51 180 cm 71 wingspan x 90 cm 35 5 depth when folded into a triangle notes le square is worked in the round starting with 8 sts divided into 4 sections increases are worked before and after each stitch marker on every other round total of 8 sts increased the shawl therefore increases at a rate of 40 sts after every stockinette and slip_stitch section if you are having difficulty getting started in the round alternative co directions to begin flat can be found at the end of the pattern consider switching from dpns to circular needles when size permits for a more comfortable knitting experience we used 16 24 and 40 circular needles to complete the shawl when starting with dpns imagine that there is a stitch marker at both ends of each dpn in order to understand when to do the increases and when transferring to circulars add your stitch markers as well as a bor marker do not break yarn between sections rather carry the yarn throughout the project there is no need to lock the cc during the stockinette section however make sure that you have enough slack in the cc between sections so that your shawl will lay flat after blocking © sonder yarn co 2023 | www sonderyarnco com | for personal use only le square | page 3 directions for knitting in the round with mc co 8 sts dividing sts equally onto 4 dpns note you may want to add a locking stitch marker on your work at the beginning of your first dpn to identify your bor prep row round 1 k round 2 kfb every st 16 sts main body stockinette section knit with mc round 1 *kfb k to 1 st before marker kfb sm repeat from * 3 more times round 2 *k until the end of the round sm as you come to them repeat rounds 1 & 2 3 more times for a total of 8 rounds 32 sts increased slip_stitch
